By the way the game gets to be a little more fun once you strap a missile launcher to the hood of the car. Then the blocks need to dodge you lol

author: @iaml.4290
text: Hi in case anyone wanted to know how to have the multiple blocks falling, I've just made a simple program that does it without the rest of the program used in the video.  import pygame import random  pygame.init()  Block_Wid_Hei = 50, 50 ScreenResolution = Width, Height = 800,600 GameDisplay = pygame.display.set_mode(ScreenResolution) pygame.display.set_caption("Falling Objects") clock = pygame.time.Clock() White = [255,255,255] Black = [0,0,0]  def End_Game():     pygame.quit     quit()  MultipleBlocks = [] for BlocksPosition in range(20):     x = random.randrange(0,ScreenResolution[0])     y = random.randrange(0,ScreenResolution[1])     w = Block_Wid_Hei[0]     h = Block_Wid_Hei[1]     MultipleBlocks.append([x,y,w,h])  Game_Running  = True  while Game_Running:     for event in pygame.event.get():         if event.type == pygame.QUIT:             End_Game()      GameDisplay.fill(Black)      for i in MultipleBlocks:         i[1] += 5         pygame.draw.rect(GameDisplay, White, i)         if i[1] > ScreenResolution[1]:             i[1] = random.randrange(-50, -10)             i[0] = random.randrange(0,ScreenResolution[0])     pygame.display.update()     clock.tick(60)  End_Game()

author: @fluffypotato3357
text: If you're looking to expand on the game, here's a few ideas: - Highscore - Lives - Upgrade blocks that give you extra points/lives (these should have a different color) - Other upgrades such as turbo, grenade (that clears the screen of all blocks) and "block-freeze" (giving you extra time to escape the blocks) - A screen that shows up after you have crashed showing the high scores and giving you the option to play again or quit - An intro splash screen that gives you the option to set the difficulty - Make it possible to play time-based, infinite or score based - A way to store points - Create a store where you can spend your collected points on upgrades and cars with different specs (faster cars, cars with more starting lives, cars that can move up and down in addition to left and right) - Jumping (hit space bar to jump over objects when you don't have time to dodge them) - Changing the blocks into other things like cones, containers, a cat etc.  Please feel free to comment more suggestions! :)

author: @OuterSpacedVideos
text: I added a little something to my game so that the speed increases by one for every 10 blocks you dodge. After the if statement that resets the block if it hits the bottom of the screen I put:  if dodged % 10 == 0:    thing_speed += 1  So if the score is divisible by 10 when the block resets, the speed is increased. This stops the game from getting so crazy so fast. It's nothing too fancy, but I haven't been coding for long so I was pretty proud of it :P Just thought I'd share in case other people wanted to do something similar.   Also thanks for making this series, you make every really easy to follow and I feel like it's helped me progress quite a lot.

author: @andrewsrambles7425
text: hi I tried to add a bit of animation to the car if you push left the car image changes etc... it was working well until I put the main game loop in a function any help would be appreciated i'm sure its something simple  import pygame import sys import time import random  pygame.init() display_width = 800 display_height = 600  black = (0,0,0) white = (255,255,255) red = (255,0,0) green = (0,255,0) blue = (0,0,255) cyan = (0,127,127) sky = (144, 209, 242) window = pygame.display.set_mode((display_width,display_height),0,32) #window size  window.fill(sky) car_width = 40 pygame.display.set_caption('A bit Racey') #title  clock = pygame.time.Clock()  carStart = pygame.image.load('car.png') #loads image carLeft = pygame.image.load('car_left.png') #loads image carRight = pygame.image.load('car_right.png') #loads image carImg = carStart #sets default image  def things_dodged(count):     font =pygame.font.SysFont(None,25)     text = font.render("Dodged: "+str(count), True, black)     window.blit(text,(0,0))  def things(thingx, thingy, thingw, thingh, colour):     pygame.draw.rect(window, colour, [thingx, thingy,thingw, thingh])  def car(x,y):       #car function     window.blit(carImg,(x,y))   #displays car at x,y     pygame.display.update()  def text_objects(text, font):     textSurface = font.render(text, True, black)     return textSurface , textSurface.get_rect()  def message_display(text):     largeText = pygame.font.Font('freesansbold.ttf',115)     TextSurf, TextRect = text_objects(text, largeText)     TextRect.center = ((display_width/2),(display_height/2))     window.blit(TextSurf, TextRect)     pygame.display.update()     time.sleep(2)      game_loop()  def crash():     message_display('You Crashed')   def game_loop():      x = (display_width * 0.45) #car starting point     y = (display_height * 0.8)     x_change = 0     y_change = 0     dodged = 0     carImg = carStart      thing_startx = random.randrange(0, display_width)     thing_starty = -600     thing_speed = 3     thing_width = 100     thing_height = 100      gameExit = False      while not gameExit: #loops while gameExit = false          for event in pygame.event.get():             if event.type == pygame.QUIT:                 pygame.quit()                 quit()              if event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:    #detects if key has been pressed                 if event.key == pygame.K_LEFT:  #checks to see if it was the left key pushed                     x_change = -5                     carImg = carLeft           #image was changing here but not any more                                      elif event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT:   #checks for right key press                     x_change = 5                     carImg = carRight          #image was changing here but not any more                                    if event.type == pygame.KEYUP:                 if event.key == pygame.K_LEFT or event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT:  #detects if keys are relesed                     x_change = 0                     carImg = carStart                                  print(event)           x += x_change         #things(thingx, thingy, thingw, thingh, colour):          window.fill(sky)         things(thing_startx ,thing_starty, thing_width, thing_height, red)         thing_starty += thing_speed         car(x,y)         things_dodged(dodged)          if x > display_width - car_width or x < 0:             crash()          if thing_starty > display_height:             thing_starty = 0 - thing_height             thing_startx = random.randrange(0, display_width)             dodged += 1             thing_speed += 1          if y < thing_starty+thing_height:             print('y crossover')              if x > thing_startx and x < thing_startx + thing_width or x+car_width > thing_startx and x + car_width < thing_startx+thing_width:                 print('x crossover')                 crash()         pygame.display.update()         clock.tick(60)  game_loop()  pygame.quit() quit()

author: @oh_itsmike
text: okay so I'm trying to replace the rectangle we drew with another car. The game works, the car crashes and it adds the points however I can't see the other car that used to be the rectangle. Can you please help me out? Here's the code  import pygame import time import random pygame.init() #^ Initialised allpygame necessities ^ #Setting up the game window (Surface) display_width = 800 display_height = 600 black = (0,0,0) #Defining colours using RGB white = (255,255,255) red = (255, 0, 0) block_colour = (53,115,255) car_width = 70 car_height = 130 cardodge_width = 70 cardodge_height = 130 gameDisplay = pygame.display.set_mode((display_width,display_height)) pygame.display.set_caption('Road Rampage') clock = pygame.time.Clock() #Game Clock carImg = pygame.image.load('car.png') #Loading car into the background. CURRENTLY NOT DISPLAYED. cardodgeImg = pygame.image.load('cardodge.png') def things_dodged(count): #Score     font = pygame.font.SysFont(None, 25)     text = font.render("Score: "+str(count), True, black)     gameDisplay.blit(text, (0,0)) def things(x,y): #Obsticle function     gameDisplay.blit(cardodgeImg,(x,y))     def car(x,y):     gameDisplay.blit(carImg,(x,y)) def text_objects(text, font):     textSurface = font.render(text, True, red)     return textSurface, textSurface.get_rect() def message_display(text):     largeText = pygame.font.Font('freesansbold.ttf',115)     TextSurf, TextRect = text_objects(text, largeText)     TextRect.center = ((display_width/2),(display_height/2))     gameDisplay.blit(TextSurf, TextRect)     pygame.display.update()     time.sleep(2)     game_loop() def crash():     message_display('You Crashed!')  def game_loop():     x = (display_width * 0.45)     y = (display_height * 0.7)      #Game loop and logic     x_change = 0     thing_startx = random.randrange(0, display_width)     thing_starty = -600     thing_speed = 4     thing_width = 100     thing_height = 100     score = 0         gameExit = False     while not gameExit:         for event in pygame.event.get():             if event.type == pygame.QUIT:                 pygame.quit()                 quit()            #Movement             if event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:                 if event.key == pygame.K_LEFT:                     x_change = -5                 if event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT:                     x_change = 5             if event.type == pygame.KEYUP:                 if event.key == pygame.K_LEFT or event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT:                     x_change = 0         x += x_change              gameDisplay.fill(white)         #things(thingx, thingy, thingw, thingh, color) <--Parameters for things (obsticles)         things(x,y)         thing_starty += thing_speed         car(x,y)         things_dodged(score)                 if x > display_width - car_width or x < 0:             crash()         if thing_starty > display_height:             thing_starty = 0 - thing_height             thing_startx = random.randrange(0,display_width)             score += 1             thing_speed += 0.5             thing_width += (score * 1.2)         if y < thing_starty+thing_height:             print('y crossover')             if x > thing_startx and x < thing_startx + thing_width or x+car_width > thing_startx and x + car_width < thing_startx+thing_width:                 print('x crossover')                 crash()                 pygame.display.update()         clock.tick(60)         game_loop() pygame.quit() quit()

text: I set carspeed as 4 and added it to event.key and then I did "Turning speed: (carspeeding)"             if thing_starty > display_height:             thing_starty = 0 - thing_height             thing_startx = random.randrange(0,display_width)             dodged += 1             thing_speed +=0.50             thing_width += (dodged * 1.2)             carspeed += 1             carspeeding += 1 worked fine but when I try carspeeding += 0.10 it changes to "Turning speed: 4.99999999999999" any help?
